name: People From The Ancient World Online Quiz | Other People | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following was NOT a leader of the Persian Empire?
questions.explanation:
Lepidus.

	Lepidus was a Roman. (There were more than one Darius,Cyrus and Xerxes)

questions.text: This Greek was raised by Pericles and acquainted with Socrates:
questions.explanation:
Alcibiades.

	He had a most interesting and turbulent life. It ended violently.

questions.text: This Carthaginian General is perhaps best known for crossing the Alps.
questions.explanation:
Hannibal.

	All were great leaders, but Hannibal crossed the Alps.

questions.text: This soldier described in 'The Anabasis' how he led his retreating army on a difficult trek home.
questions.explanation:
Xenophon.

	Classic example of 'rising to the occasion'.

questions.text: Which individual was NOT a member of the First Triumvirate of Rome?
questions.explanation:
Sulla.

	Sulla was from a different time period.

questions.text: Seneca, Horace, Virgil and Ovid were all from what Empire?
questions.explanation:
Roman.

	They were Romans all. Seneca's life was filled with intrigue; he and Nero didn't get along.

questions.text: This leader perished along with his (mostly Spartan) soldiers at Thermopylae, when they defended their people against invading forces.
questions.explanation:
Leonidas.

	This was a sort of a heroic early version of 'Custer's Last Stand'.

questions.text: Troy was often believed to be a myth until it was discovered by this man:
questions.explanation:
Heinrich Schliemann.

	This is a classic tale of a true believer who devoted his life to seeking what he believed in, it paid off.

questions.text: Who found King Tut's tomb in the 'Valley of the Kings'?
questions.explanation:
Howard Carter.

	Lord Carnarvon sponsored the venture to Egypt and the tomb was discovered by Howard Carter in 1922.

questions.text: Thucydides and Herodotus are famous for what accomplishments?
questions.explanation:
They were Greek Historians.

	They were two towering Historians of their culture.
